comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The young bongo player, whose long-fingered hands are in close-up on the next couple of pictures, intrigues me. Two young percussionists played with Morales about this time before starting their own band. One was Tito Puente and the other Pete Terrace (he used an anglicized form of his real name, which was Pedro Gutierrez). This does not look likeTito Puente to me. A young Puente is at: www.clevescene.com/c-notes/archives/2009/05/14/tito-puent... reynaldo82.com/extras/tito-puente-cuban-carnival.html But could it be Pete Terrace? mysteryposter.blogspot.com/2008/03/pete-terrace-his-orche... www.herencialatina.com/Joe_Loco/Pete_Terrace_Going_Loco_2... I can't convince myself either way.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The woman may be Nita Del Campo, who sang with the band and was Noro's wife. See www.historyforsale.com/html/prodetails.asp?documentid=279... for a picture. www.herencialatina.com/La_guerra_en_el_cancionero/La_Guer... certainly seems to be the same woman (identified as Nita Del Campo), possibly even wearing the same dress.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Another candidate for the bongo player would appear to be a Ramon Rivera, according to books.google.com/books?id=-R4EAAAAMBAJ&pg=PT35&lp... Billboard Oct 25, 1947

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I've just noticed that www.herencialatina.com/La_guerra_en_el_cancionero/Noro_Ba... a picture from the page I mentioned above ( www.herencialatina.com/La_guerra_en_el_cancionero/La_Guer... ) is clearly taken in the same location as this picture. Look at the wall behind Noro.
